newsitem.title: USA: U.S. fund flows drop during 2-day period - survey.
newsitem.headline: U.S. fund flows drop during 2-day period - survey.

text.p: U.S. equity funds posted cash inflows of $182 million during the two-day period, ended December 23, compared to $675 million during the three-day period, ended December 19, according to Mutual Fund Trim Tabs.
International funds recorded inflows of $59 million versus $228 million for the same period, according to the Santa Rosa, Calif.-based fund tracker.

U.S. agressive growth showed a significantly downturn, with outflows of $69 million versus inflows of $639 million. Growth funds showed a slight gain in inflows to $137 million from $109 million, while equity income funds ionflows slowed to $23 million from $129 million.
Bond funds recorded a sharp turnaround in the two periods to inflows of $603 million from outflows of $483 million.

Government/GNMA funds had inflows of $50 million versus outflows of $154 million, muni funds had inflows of $305 million versus outflows of $280 million, and high yield funds had inflows of $33 million versus outflows of $21 million.
